Determines if any of the users credenditals have expired (the password was reset and needs to be changed or the password is old).

This interface defines the method that JCatapult framework locates users and returns them in a generic fashion.
AuthorizationException - Exception in org.jcatapult.security.auth
This class is thrown when the user is logged in but is lacking the correct credentials to access a specific resource.
AuthorizationException() - Constructor for exception org.jcatapult.security.auth.AuthorizationException
 
AuthorizationExceptionHandler - Interface in org.jcatapult.security.servlet.auth
This interface handles authorization exceptions that are thrown by the Authorizer out to the AuthorizationWorkflow.
AuthorizationWorkflow - Class in org.jcatapult.security.servlet.auth
This class is a workflow that grabs the incoming request URI and authorizes the current user (or current request if there is no user) against that request URI.
AuthorizationWorkflow(Authorizer, NotLoggedInHandler, AuthorizationExceptionHandler) - Constructor for class org.jcatapult.security.servlet.auth.AuthorizationWorkflow
 
authorize(Object, String) - Method in interface org.jcatapult.security.auth.Authorizer
Authorize the given user for the given resource.
authorize(Object, String) - Method in class org.jcatapult.security.auth.ConfiguredAuthorizer
 
Authorizer - Interface in org.jcatapult.security.auth
This class is the abstract method that is used by the JCatapult security framework for authorizing users against application resources.
